results.title: In Rare Alliance, Democrats and Republicans Seek Legal Power to Clear Homeless Camps
results.abstract: Dozens of leaders, mostly from Western states, have asked the Supreme Court to overturn lower court decisions that restrict enforcement against public camping.

media.caption: A homeless encampment in Phoenix in February.

results.title: U.S. Accuses Amazon of Illegally Protecting Monopoly in Online Retail
results.abstract: The Federal Trade Commission and 17 states sued Amazon, saying its conduct in its online store and services to merchants illegally stifled competition.

media.caption: Much of Amazon’s power comes from its online marketplace, sometimes known as an “everything store” for the range of products it sells and the speed with which it delivers them.

results.title: Brooks Robinson, Slick-Fielding Hall of Fame Third Baseman, Dies at 86
results.abstract: In his 23-year career, all of it with the Baltimore Orioles, he had 2,848 hits and 268 home runs. But he was best known for his unparalleled defense.

media.caption: Brooks Robinson in 1967. He became known as the Human Vacuum Cleaner for his ability to snare just about anything hit his way.

results.title: The Magic Number: 32 Hours a Week

results.title: Terry Kirkman, Whose Band Was a Late-1960s Hit Machine, Dies at 83
results.abstract: A singer, songwriter and virtuoso musician, he was a founder of the clean-cut group the Association and wrote one of its biggest hits, “Cherish.”

media.caption: Terry Kirkman of the Association in an undated photo. He said that he laid down the basis of the group's enduring hit “Cherish” in a little more than 30 minutes.

results.title: Biden’s Dog Bites Another Secret Service Officer

results.title: Juilliard’s Top-Tier Graduate Acting Program Is Going Tuition-Free
results.abstract: Starting with the next academic year, the drama school will eliminate an “unrealistic burden” for graduate acting students.

results.title: In Summer Heat, ‘Artificial Shortages’ in Texas Grid May Have Cost $8 Billion
results.abstract: Electricity prices soared even when supply was ample, an independent monitor said. The state’s market operator said it was intentional.
